intro: Lycoseris boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian lycoseris, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss, while its flowers are small and clustered. Lycoseris boliviana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
